snippet: A museum in Asheville, N.C., celebrates a home to art titans in the 1930s, ’40s and ’50s, that champions experimentation among artists working today.
abstract: Black Mountain College Museum & Arts Center, institution dedicated to keeping work of progressive Black Mountain College alive, opens new expansion that features study space along with galleries; college, which closed in 1957, boasts rich legacy of artists and championed many new forms of art.
lead_paragraph: A museum in Asheville, N.C., celebrates a home to art titans in the 1930s, ’40s and ’50s, that champions experimentation among artists working today.

headline.main: In the Spirit of Black Mountain College, an Avant-Garde Incubator
headline.print_headline: New Life for Cradle of Avant-Garde

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Black Mountain College Museum & Arts Center
